verses.latin: Verba Amos, qui fuit in pastoribus de Thecue, quae vidit super Ierusalem, in diebus Oziae regis Iuda, et in diebus Ieroboam filii Ioas regis Israhel, ante duos annos terraemotus.
verses.english: These are the words of Amos, who was a shepherd from Tekoa. He saw visions about Jerusalem during the reign of King Uzziah of Judah and during the reign of Jeroboam, son of Joash, king of Israel. This happened two years before the earthquake.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Dominus ex Sion rugiet, et de Ierusalem dabit vocem suam: et luxerunt speciosa pastorum, et exsiccata est summitas Carmeli.
verses.english: Amos said: “The Lord will roar from Zion, and He will make His voice heard from Jerusalem, so the beautiful pastures will mourn, and the top of Mount Carmel will dry up.”

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus Damasci, et super quatuor, non convertam eum, eo quod trituraverint in serris ferratis Galaad.
verses.english: The Lord says: “For the three transgressions of Damascus and for the four, I will not relent; because they have threshed Gilead with iron sledges.

verses.latin: Et mittam ignem in domum Azael, et comedet fundamenta Benadad.
verses.english: “So I will send a fire upon the house of Hazael, and it shall devour the strongholds of Ben-hadad.

verses.latin: Et conteram vectem Damasci, et disperdam habitantem de campo Idolatriae, et tenentem sceptrum de domo voluptatis, et adnihilabitur populus Syriae, et reliqui qui erunt de filiis Israël, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “I will break the gate of Damascus. And I will destroy the one who rules from the valley of Aven, the one who holds the scepter from the house of Eden. The people of Aram will be exiled, along with the remnant of the Israelites,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus Gazae, et super quatuor, non convertam eam, eo quod transtulerint captivitatem perfectam, ut concluderent eam in Edom.
verses.english: The Lord says: “For the three transgressions of Gaza and for the four, I will not relent; because they took captives and deported them to Edom.”

verses.latin: Et mittam ignem in murum Gazae, et comedet palatia eius.
verses.english: “So I will send a fire upon the wall of Gaza, and it will consume its fortresses.

verses.latin: Et disperdam habitantem de Azoto, et tenentem sceptrum de Ascalon, et convertam manum meam super Accaron, et peribunt reliquiae Philisthinorum, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: “I will destroy the one who rules from Ashdod, and the one who holds the scepter from Ashkelon. I will turn my hand against Ekron, and the remnant of the Philistines will perish,” says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus Tyri, et super quatuor, non convertam eum, eo quod concluserint captivos perfectos in Idumea.
verses.english: The Lord says: “For the three transgressions of Tyre and for the four, I will not relent; because they delivered up an entire population of captives to Edom.

verses.latin: Et mittam ignem in murum Tyri, et comedet palatia eius.
verses.english: “So I will send a fire upon the wall of Tyre, and it shall devour its fortresses.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus Idumeae, et super quatuor, non convertam eum, eo quod persecutus sit in gladio fratrem suum, et compresserit misericordias suas, et in furore suo fregerit, et iram suam observaverit semper.
verses.english: The Lord says: “For the three transgressions of Edom and for the four, I will not relent; because he pursued his brother with the sword and cast off all pity, and his anger tore at all that was good, and he kept his wrath forever.

verses.latin: Et mittam ignem in Theman, et comedet palatia Bosrae.
verses.english: “So I will send a fire upon Teman, and it shall devour the fortresses of Bozrah.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus filiorum Ammon, et super quatuor, non convertam eum, eo quod dissecuerint praegnantes Galaad, ut dilatarent terminos suos.
verses.english: The Lord says: “For the three transgressions of the Ammonites and for the four, I will not relent; because they have ripped open the pregnant women of Gilead, that they might enlarge their border.

verses.latin: Et succendam ignem in muro Rabbae, et comedet palatia eius, in ululatu in die belli, et in turbine in die tempestatis.
verses.english: “So I will kindle a fire upon the wall of Rabbah, and it shall devour its fortresses, with shouting on the day of battle, with a storm on the day of the tempest.

verses.latin: Et transibit rex eorum cum principibus suis simul, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “And their king will go into exile, along with his princes,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: In tribus sceleribus Moab, et in quatuor, non convertam eum: eo quod incenderit ossa regis Edom in favillam.
verses.english: The Lord says this: "Moab has committed three crimes, and I will not turn away from punishing them, for they have desecrated the bones of the king of Edom by burning them to ashes.

verses.latin: Mittam ignem in Moab, et comedet palatia Carioth: et morietur in clangore Moab, in ululatu tubae.
verses.english: So, I will send fire against Moab that will consume its fortresses, and Moab will die in battle, with the shouts and blare of the war horn.

verses.latin: Et disperdam iudicem de medio eius, et universos principes eius interficiam cum eo, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: I will destroy their leaders, and I will kill their rulers with them, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: In tribus sceleribus Iuda, et in quatuor, non convertam eum: eo quod abjecerint legem Domini, et mandata eius non custodierint: sed deceperunt eos idola sua, post quae ambulave- runt patres eorum.
verses.english: The Lord says: "Judah has committed three crimes, and I will not turn away from punishing them, because they have rejected the law of the Lord, and have not kept His commandments. Their idols have deceived them, and they followed the same sinful paths as their ancestors.

verses.latin: Mittam ignem in Iudam, et devorabit palatia Ierusalem.
verses.english: So I will send fire against Judah, and it will consume the fortresses of Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: In tribus sceleribus Israhel, et in quatuor, non convertam eum: eo quod vendiderint argentum pauperem, et pauperem pro calceamentorum, et pulverem pauperum super caput terrae inclinaverint.
verses.english: The Lord says: "Israel has committed three crimes, and I will not turn away from punishing them, for they have sold the innocent for silver, and the poor for a pair of shoes. They trample the heads of the poor into the dust of the earth.

verses.latin: Qui conterunt in pulverem capita pauperum, et humiles viam suam declinaverunt: filius et pater iverunt in puellas, ut contaminarent nomen sanctum meum.
verses.english: They oppress the poor, and they turn away from the needs of the humble. Fathers and sons exploit young women, which desecrates My holy Name.

verses.latin: Super vestimenta autem datis pignora, et super vestimentum eorum, calicem vinorum in domo Dei eorum biberunt.
verses.english: They take pledges of clothing, and they drink the wine of the condemned in the house of their God.

verses.latin: Ego autem disperdi Amorreum a facie eorum, cujus altitudo cedrorum altitudo ejus, et fortis quasi quercus.
verses.english: I destroyed the Amorites before them, although they were as tall as the cedars and as strong as the oaks.

verses.latin: Et perdidi fructum ejus desuper, et radicem ejus deorsum.
verses.english: I destroyed their fruit above, and their roots below.

verses.latin: Ego vos eduxi de terra Aegypti, et duxi vos in deserto quadraginta annis, ut possideretis terram Amorreorum.
verses.english: I brought you out of the land of Egypt, and I led you through the desert for forty years, so that you might possess the land of the Amorites.

verses.latin: Et suscitavi de filiis vestris prophetas, et de juvenibus vestris Nazaraeos. Numquid non est ita, filii Israhel? dicit Dominus.
verses.english: I raised up prophets from among your own sons, and I raised up Nazarites from among your young men. Isn't that the truth, children of Israel? says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et contristrastis Nazaraeos vino, et prophetas vestros praecipiebatis dicentes: Ne prophetetis.
verses.english: But you made the Nazarites drink wine, and you commanded your prophets, saying, "Do not prophesy."

verses.latin: Ecce ego constringam vos, sicut constringit plaustrum gravedinem, cum plenum fuerit faenum: et non erit fuga veloci, et fortis non roburabit vires suas, et robustus non salvabit animam suam.
verses.english: I will press you down, as a cart presses down the sheaves of grain after the harvest. No swift runner will escape, the strong will not retain their strength, and the brave will not save their lives.

verses.latin: Et qui tenet arcum, non stabit: et velox pede non salvabitur, neque qui equitat equum, salvabit animam suam.
verses.english: The archer will not stand his ground, the swift of foot will not escape, and the horseman will not save his life.

verses.latin: Audax cor in fortibus in die illa, dicit Dominus: et multiplicabo impios.
verses.english: On that day, even the bravest of warriors will flee in terror, says the Lord. I will multiply those who are wicked.

verses.latin: Audite verbum hoc, quod ego loquor super vos, filii Israël: universa familia quam eduxi de terra Ægypti, dicens:
verses.english: Hear this word which I speak against you, children of Israel, against the entire family I brought out of the land of Egypt, saying:

verses.latin: Vos solos cognovi ex omnibus familiis terræ: ideo visitabo contra vos omnes iniquitates vestras.
verses.english: “I have known only you of all the families of the earth. Therefore, I will visit against you all your iniquities.”

verses.latin: Si duo ambulabunt simul, nisi convenerint?
verses.english: If two walk together, unless they have agreed?

verses.latin: Num rugiet leo in silva, si non habuerit prædam? Num dabit catulus in cubili suo vocem, nisi acceperit aliquid?
verses.english: Will a lion roar in the forest if it doesn't have prey? Will a young lion give its cry in its den if it has captured nothing?

verses.latin: Num cadet avis in laqueum terræ, absque causa? Num tolletur laqueus de terra, priusquam aliquid ceperit?
verses.english: Does a bird fall into a snare on the earth without cause? Is the snare taken up from the earth before it has caught something?

verses.latin: Si clanget tuba in civitate, et populus non paveat? Si erit malum in civitate, quod Dominus non fecerit?
verses.english: If a trumpet sounds in a city, will the people not be afraid? If there is evil in a city, hasn't the Lord done it?

verses.latin: Quia non faciet Dominus Deus verbum, nisi revelaverit secretum suum ad servos suos prophetas.
verses.english: Indeed, the Lord God does nothing unless He reveals His secret to His servants, the prophets.

verses.latin: Leo rugiet, quis non timebit? Dominus Deus locutus est, quis non prophetabit?
verses.english: A lion roars, who will not fear? The Lord God has spoken; who will not prophesy?

verses.latin: Audite super domum Jacob, et omnes reliquias domus Israël, qui portatis, qui estis quasi super gradum, et qui facitis iniquitatem.
verses.english: Proclaim this against the house of Jacob and to all the remaining members of the house of Israel: You who carry on, you who are like the high places, and you who practice iniquity.

verses.latin: Qui odistis eum qui arguit in porta, et detestamini eum qui loquitur perfecte.
verses.english: You hate the one who reproves in the gate, and you detest the one who speaks perfectly.

verses.latin: Ideo, pro eo quod calcatis pauperem, et tributum frumenti tollitis ab eo: domos de lapidibus quadris ædificastis, sed non habitabitis in eis: vineas plantastis præciosas, et non bibetis vinum ex eis.
verses.english: Therefore, because you trample on the poor, and take a tribute of grain from them, you have built houses of squared stones, but you will not live in them; you have planted precious vineyards, but you will not drink wine from them.

verses.latin: Quia scio multa scelera vestra, et fortia peccata vestra: odientes justos, accipientes pretium, et pauperes opprimentes in porta.
verses.english: For I know your many crimes and your strong sins: hating the just, taking a bribe, and oppressing the poor in the gate.

verses.latin: Ideo sapiens silebit in tempore illo, quia tempus malum est.
verses.english: Therefore, the wise man will keep silent at that time, because it is a bad time.

verses.latin: Quærite bonum, et non malum, ut vivatis: et erit Dominus Deus exercituum vobiscum, sicut dixistis.
verses.english: Seek good and not evil, that you may live; and so the Lord God of hosts will be with you, as you have said.

verses.latin: Odiste malum, et diligite bonum, et constituite in porta judicium: si forte misereatur Dominus Deus exercituum reliquiis Joseph.
verses.english: Hate evil and love good, and establish judgment in the gate; perhaps the Lord God of hosts will have mercy on the remnant of Joseph.

verses.latin: Ideo hæc dicit Dominus Deus exercituum, Dominus: Planctus erit in plateis, et in cunctis viis dicent: Væ, væ! et vocabunt agricolam ad luctum, et ad planctum eos qui sciunt plangere.
verses.english: Therefore, the Lord God of hosts, the Lord, says this: There will be wailing in the streets, and in all the roads they will say, “Woe, woe!” They will call the farmer to mourning, and those who know how to wail to lament.

verses.latin: Et in omnibus vineis erit ululatus, quia transibo per medium tui, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: And there will be wailing in all the vineyards, because I will pass through the midst of you, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Væ qui desideratis diem Domini: ad quid vobis hoc? Dies Domini, tenebræ et non lux.
verses.english: Woe to you who desire the day of the Lord! Why is this to you? The day of the Lord is darkness and not light.

verses.latin: Quasi cum fugiat vir a facie leonis, et occurrat ei ursus: et ingrediatur domum, et sustineat manu super parietem, et percutiat eum serpens.
verses.english: It is like a man who flees from a lion, and a bear meets him; and he goes into a house and rests his hand on the wall, and a serpent strikes him.

verses.latin: Numquid non tenebræ dies Domini, et non lux? et caligo, et non splendor in ea?
verses.english: Surely the day of the Lord will be darkness and not light? It will be gloom and not splendor in it?

verses.latin: Odi, et projeci festos vestros, et non odorabo cœtus vestros.
verses.english: I hate and I have rejected your festivals; and I will not smell your assemblies.

verses.latin: Quia si obtuleritis mihi holocausta, et munera vestra, non suscipiam: et pacem pinguium vestrorum non respiciam.
verses.english: Because if you offer me holocausts and your gifts, I will not receive them, and I will not look upon the peace offerings of your fat beasts.

verses.latin: Aufer a me sonitum cantionum tuarum, et canticum psalterii tui non audiam.
verses.english: Take away from me the sound of your songs; I will not hear the song of your psaltery.

verses.latin: Sed fluat judicium quasi aqua, et justitia quasi torrens potens.
verses.english: But let judgment flow like water, and justice like a mighty torrent.

verses.latin: Numquid victimas et sacrificia obtulistis mihi in deserto quadraginta annis, domus Israël?
verses.english: Did you offer victims and sacrifices to me in the desert for forty years, house of Israel?

verses.latin: Et portastis tabernaculum Moloch vestro, et sidus dei vestri, quæ fecistis vobis.
verses.english: And you carried the tabernacle of your Moloch and the star of your god, which you made for yourselves.

verses.latin: Et transmigrare vos faciam ultra Damascum, dicit Dominus, Deus exercituum nomen ejus.
verses.english: And I will make you go into exile beyond Damascus, says the Lord, whose name is the God of hosts.

verses.latin: Audite verbum hoc, vaccæ Basan, quæ estis in monte Samariæ, quæ calumniam facitis egenis, et confringitis pauperes: quæ dicitis dominis vestris: Afferte, et veniemus.
verses.english: Listen to this, you wealthy women of Samaria, who oppress the poor, and crush the needy, who say to your husbands, “Bring us wine!”

verses.latin: Juravit Dominus in sancto suo, quia ecce dies venient super vos, et tollent vos in contis, et reliquias vestras in ollas.
verses.english: The Lord swears by His holiness, “Behold, the days are coming upon you, when they shall take you away with hooks, and what is left of you with fishhooks.”

verses.latin: Et egrediemini per ruinas contra unamquamque, et projicietis in Hermon, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: You shall go out through breaches in the walls, each one straight ahead, and you will be cast into the Hermon mountain,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Venite in Bethel, et impie agite: in Galgala, et multiplicate prævaricationem: et afferte mane victimas vestras, tribus diebus decimas vestras.
verses.english: Go to Bethel and sin; go to Gilgal and multiply transgression! Offer your sacrifices every morning, and your tithes every three days.

verses.latin: Et incensum de fermentato, et clamate voluntariam, et annuntiate: quia sic voluistis, filii Israël, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: Offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving, and proclaim it, and announce the offerings of freewill. For this is what you love, children of Israel!” says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Et ego dedi vobis immunditiam dentium et in omnibus civitatibus vestris, et in omnibus panibus vestris: et non redistis ad me, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: I gave you also cleanness of teeth in all your cities, and lack of bread in all your places, and yet you have not returned to Me,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Et ego prohibui a vobis pluviis, cum adhuc tres menses superessent: et plui super unam civitatem, et super alteram civitatem non plui: una pars pluebat, et pars super quam non pluerat, aruit.
verses.english: And I also withheld the rain from you when there were still three months to the harvest. I caused it to rain on one city, and caused it not to rain on another city. One part was rained upon, and the part on which it did not rain withered.

verses.latin: Et venerunt duæ, tres civitates ad unam civitatem ut biberent aquam, et non sunt satiatæ: et non redistis ad me, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: So two or three cities wandered to one city to drink water, and were not satisfied, and yet you have not returned to Me,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Percussi vos in vento urente et in aurugine: multitudinem hortorum vestrorum, et vinearum vestrarum, et olivetorum vestrorum comedit eruca: et non redistis ad me, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: I smote you with a burning wind and blight. Your gardens and your vineyards and your olive orchards the locust consumed, and yet you have not returned to Me,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Misi in vos pestilentiam in via Ægypti: occidi in gladio juvenes vestros cum captivitatibus equorum vestrorum, et ascendere fœtores castrorum vestrorum in nares vestras: et non redistis ad me, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: I sent among you pestilence after the manner of Egypt. I slew your young men with the sword, along with your captured horses, and I made the stench of your camps come up to your nostrils, and yet you have not returned to Me,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Subverti in vobis, sicut subvertit Deus Sodomam et Gomorrham, et facti estis quasi titiones extractæ de incendio: et non redistis ad me, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: I overthrew some of you, as God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah, and you were like a brand plucked from the burning, and yet you have not returned to Me,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Ideo hæc faciam tibi, Israël: quia hæc faciam tibi, præparare te, Israël, in occursum Dei tui.
verses.english: Therefore, I will do this to you, O Israel; and because I will do this to you, prepare to meet your God, O Israel.

verses.latin: Quia ecce formans montes, et creans ventum, et annuntians homini quid sit sensus ejus: faciens matutinam caliginem, et gradiens super excelsa terræ: Dominus Deus exercituum nomen ejus.
verses.english: For behold, He who forms the mountains, and creates the wind, and declares to man what his thoughts are, who makes the morning darkness, and treads on the heights of the earth—the Lord, the God of hosts, is His name.

verses.latin: Audite verbum istud, quod ego assumo super vos planctum, domus Israël.
verses.english: Hear this word, because I am mourning over you, people of Israel.

verses.latin: Cecidit, et non adjiciet ultra orationem Israël.
verses.english: Israel has fallen and will not rise again.

verses.latin: Ideo ista dicit Dominus Deus: Civitas de qua egrediebantur mille, relinquentur in centum: et quae egrediebantur de centum, relinquentur in decem, domus Israël.
verses.english: Because of this, God says, “The city that once provided a thousand soldiers will have only a hundred left. And the city that had a hundred soldiers will have only ten left, O people of Israel.”

verses.latin: Hæc enim dicit Dominus domui Israël: Quærite me, et vivetis:
verses.english: For God says to the people of Israel, “Seek Me, and you will live.

verses.latin: et nolite quærere Bethel, et in Galgala ne ingrediamini, et in Bersabee ne transieritis: quoniam Galgala captiva ducetur, et Bethel erit sine gloria.
verses.english: Don’t go to Bethel. Don’t enter Gilgal, nor travel to Beersheba. Gilgal will become a ruin, and Bethel will be stripped of glory.

verses.latin: Quærite Dominum, et vivite, ne forte irruat quasi ignis domui Joseph, et devoret, et non sit qui extinguat Bethel.
verses.english: Seek God so that you may live, or else He will strike the house of Joseph like a fire, and it will consume everything, and there will be no one to extinguish it in Bethel.

verses.latin: Qui convertitis judicium in absinthium, et justitiam in terram projicitis,
verses.english: You change the meaning of justice, making it bitter like wormwood, and you throw righteousness to the ground,

verses.latin: qui facitis sidera et Confluentia, et convertitis in mane umbram mortis, et diem in noctem caliginosam: qui congregatis aquas maris, et effunditis eas super faciem terræ:
verses.english: You make the stars and the constellations, and you turn the shadow of death into morning, and the day into a dark night. You call for the waters of the sea, and pour them out over the surface of the earth.

verses.latin: qui conturbatis potentiæ super robustos, et conturbatio super fortitudinem veniet.
verses.english: You bring ruin on the strong, and ruin will come upon the mighty.

verses.latin: Odistis in porta corripientem, et loquentem perfecte abominati estis.
verses.english: You hate those who rebuke evil at the gate, and you despise those who speak the truth.

verses.latin: Ideo, pro eo quod calcatis pauperem, et tributum frumenti tollitis ab eo: domos de lapidibus quadris ædificastis, et non habitabitis in eis: vineas plantastis præclaras, et non bibetis vinum earum.
verses.english: Because you trample the poor, and collect grain from them, you have built houses of stone, but you will not live in them; you have planted vineyards, but you will not drink their wine.

verses.latin: Quoniam scio multa scelera vestra, et fortia peccata vestra: hostes justorum, accipientes pretium, et pauperes opprimentes in porta.
verses.english: For I know your many sins and the strength of your transgressions: you are enemies of the righteous, taking bribes, and oppressing the poor at the gate.

verses.latin: Ideo sapiens tacebit in tempore illo, quoniam tempus malum est.
verses.english: So at this time, the wise will be silent because it is an evil time.

verses.latin: Quærite bonum, et non malum, ut vivatis: et erit Dominus Deus exercituum vobiscum, sicut dixistis.
verses.english: Seek good, not evil, so that you may live. Then God will be with you, just as you say He is.

verses.latin: Odiui, et projeci festivitates vestras, et non suscipiam odoris coetum in solemnitatibus vestris.
verses.english: I hate and reject your feasts. I will not receive the scent of your solemn assemblies.

verses.latin: Quia si obtuleritis mihi holocausta et munera vestra, non suscipiam ea: et pacem gregis vestri respicere non volui.
verses.english: Even if you offer Me burnt offerings and gifts, I will not accept them; nor will I look at the peace offerings of your fattened animals.

verses.latin: Aufer a me tumultum carminum tuorum, et cantica lyrae tuæ non audiam.
verses.english: Take away from Me the noise of your songs; I will not listen to the music of your harps.

verses.latin: Et decurret sicut aqua judicium, et justitia sicut torrens fortis.
verses.english: But let judgment flow like water, and justice like a mighty river.

verses.latin: Numquid sacrificia et oblationes obtulistis mihi in deserto, domus Israël, annis quadraginta?
verses.english: O people of Israel, did you offer sacrifices and offerings to Me in the desert for forty years?

verses.latin: Et portastis tabernaculum Moloch vestro, et imaginem simulacrorum vestrorum, sidus Dei vestri, quæ fecistis vobis.
verses.english: You carried the tent of your god Moloch and the image of your idols, the star of your god, which you made for yourselves.

verses.latin: Et transferam vos ultra Damascum, dicit Dominus: Deus exercituum nomen ejus.
verses.english: So I will send you into exile beyond Damascus, God says. God of Hosts is His name.

verses.latin: Væ qui confiditis in monte Samariæ, robur capitis gentium, ad quos intrabat domus Israël.
verses.english: Woe to those who are so confident in the mountain of Samaria, the strength of the head of the nations, to whom the people of Israel come.

verses.latin: Transite in Chalanne, et videte: et ite inde in Emath magnam, et descendite in Geth Philisthinorum: numquid meliores sunt istæ quam regna vestra? numquid latior terminus eorum quam terminus vester?
verses.english: Go to Calneh and see it, and then go to Hamath the great, and then descend to Gath of the Philistines. Are these kingdoms better than yours? Is their territory wider than yours?

verses.latin: Qui separatis in die mali, et accedetis ad solium in diebus sabbati:
verses.english: You separate yourselves for the day of evil, and you come to the throne on the Sabbath days.

verses.latin: qui dormitis in lectis eburneis, et lascivitis in stratis vestris: et comeditis agnos de grege, et vitulos de medio armenti:
verses.english: You sleep on beds of ivory and lounge on your couches. You eat the lambs from the flock and the calves from the midst of the herd.

verses.latin: qui cantatis ad sonitum tubarum, et putatis vos esse sicut unum: qui comeditis pullos vitulorum.
verses.english: You sing along with the sound of the instruments, and you think of yourselves as one great nation, eating the best parts of the calves.

verses.latin: Ideo nunc captivi eritis primi eorum qui ducuntur: et auferetur conventus lascivientium.
verses.english: Therefore, now you will be the first to be led away as captives, and the gatherings of revelers will be taken away.

verses.latin: Vae qui securi estis in Sion, et confisi in monte Samariae, nominati per nomina, principes capitum vulgi, et introistis in domum Israel.
verses.english: Woe to those who live carelessly in Zion and think they are safe on the mountain of Samaria! You are the leaders of the most important families and clans, the men of renown, and you consider yourselves to be the leaders of Israel.

verses.latin: Ite ad Calane, et videte: et transite inde in Emath magnam, et descendite in Geth Philisthinorum, et videte si meliores sunt illae quam regna haec, si major est terminus eorum quam terminus vester?
verses.english: Go to Calneh and see. Then go on from there to Hamath the great, and go down to Gath of the Philistines. See if these kingdoms are better than yours; see if their territory is greater than yours!

verses.latin: Vos qui amovetis diem malum, et appropinquatis solium iniquitatis,
verses.english: You postpone the day of misfortune and cling to the ways of wickedness!

verses.latin: qui dormitis in lectis eburneis, et lasciviestis in stratis vestris: qui comeditis agnos de grege, et vitulos de medio armenti;
verses.english: You sleep on ivory beds and sprawl on your couches, you eat the best lambs from the flock and the finest calves from the stall;

verses.latin: qui canitis ad vocem psalterii: putatis vos, sicut David, instruménta sonorum habere:
verses.english: You sing idle songs to the music of the harp. You are conceited, as if you are David, inventing musical instruments.

verses.latin: qui bibitis vinum in phialis, et unguento optimo delibimini: et non compungitur super contritione Joseph.
verses.english: You drink wine by the bowlful, and you anoint yourselves with the finest oils, but you are not grieved over the destruction of Israel.

verses.latin: Idcirco nunc captivi erunt in principio eorum: et auferentur principes lascivorum.
verses.english: Therefore, you will now be the first to be taken into exile. The revelry of the arrogant will end.

verses.latin: Juravit Dominus in fortitudine Jacob: Si oblitus fuero usque in finem omnium operum eorum.
verses.english: The Lord God has sworn by his own power: “I detest the pride of Jacob and hate their palaces. I will deliver this city and all that is in it to the enemy.”

verses.latin: Numquid super hoc non contremiscet terra, et lugebit omnis habitator ejus? et ascendet quasi fluvius omnis, et ejicietur, et deicietur quasi fluvius AEgypti.
verses.english: Will not the land tremble for this? Will not everyone who lives there mourn? The land will be flooded like the Nile, rising and falling again like the river of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa, dicit Dominus Deus: eicientur solis tympana vestra, et cantabuntur in silentio.
verses.english: And in that day, says the Lord God: “Your songs of praise will be turned to lamentation. And the music will be silenced.

verses.latin: Et auferetur omnis cantus vestri in luctum.
verses.english: Your loud and frivolous partying will become weeping.

verses.latin: Numquid currunt in petra equi? numquid arator arabit illic in bobus? quoniam convertistis in amaritudinem judicium, et fructum justitiæ in absinthium:
verses.english: Do horses run on the rocky terrain? Does one plow there with oxen? You have turned justice into bitter poison, and the fruit of righteousness into wormwood.

verses.latin: qui gaudetis in non ente, et dicitis: Numquid non in fortitudine nostra tulimus nobis cornua?
verses.english: You are proud of what is worthless and you say, “Did we not seize power through our own strength?”

verses.latin: Ecce enim ego suscitabo super vos domum, filii Israel, dicit Dominus Deus exercituum, et affligam vos, sicut contritum est plaustrum, quod contriatur in via.
verses.english: But I am about to raise up against you, house of Israel, says the Lord, the God of hosts, and I will oppress you as a cart is crushed when it is overloaded with grain.

verses.latin: Et auferetur confugium a velocis, et fortitudo a forti, et non salvabitur robustus.
verses.english: The swift will lose their means of escape, the strong will lose their strength, and the mighty will not save themselves.

verses.latin: Et qui tenent arcum, non stabunt: et velox pede non salvabitur, nec ascendens equum salvabitur.
verses.english: Those who are skilled with a bow will not stand their ground, and the swift runner will not get away, and the horseman will not save himself.

verses.latin: Et qui audax est in corde, inter fortes, seminabit nudus in die illa, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Even the most courageous soldier will flee naked on that day, says the Lord.

verses.latin: Haec sunt quae vidit Amos, qui erat in pastoribus de Thecue: quae vidit super Israël in diebus Oziæ regis Juda, et in diebus Jeroboam filii Joas regis Israël, biennio ante terraemotum.
verses.english: These are the visions that Amos, a shepherd from Tekoa, saw about Israel, which he saw during the reigns of King Uzziah of Judah and King Jeroboam son of Joash of Israel, two years before the earthquake.

verses.latin: Et ait: Dominus de Sion rugiet, et de Jerusalem dabit vocem suam: et luxerunt speciosa pascua in deserto, et exaruit campus: quoniam maledicta est omnis terra, et omnis qui habitat in ea.
verses.english: And he said: "The Lord will roar from Zion, and He will give His voice from Jerusalem. The best pastures of the desert will mourn, and the field will wither because the whole earth is cursed, along with everyone who lives in it."

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus Damasci, et super quatuor, non convertam eum: eo quod trituraverint in serris Gilead, triturantes cum serris ferreis.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: "For three crimes of Damascus, and for four, I will not relent, because they threshed Gilead with saws, threshing them with iron saws."

verses.latin: Et mittam ignem in domum Azaël, et comedet fundamenta Benadad.
verses.english: I will send a fire into the house of Hazael, which will consume the foundations of Ben-hadad.

verses.latin: Et conteram vectem Damasci, et disperdam habitantem de campo voluptatis, et residuum Syriæ transmigrabit: dicit Dominus.
verses.english: I will break the bar of Damascus, and I will destroy the one who dwells in the field of pleasure, and the remnant of Syria will be exiled," says the Lord.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus Gazæ, et super quatuor, non convertam eum: eo quod transtulerint captivos perfectos, ut concluderent eos in Idumæa.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: "For three crimes of Gaza, and for four, I will not relent, because they took captives and sold them completely to Edom."

verses.latin: Et mittam ignem in murum Gazæ, et comedet fundamenta ejus.
verses.english: I will send fire into the walls of Gaza, and it will consume its foundations.

verses.latin: Et disperdam habitantem de Azoto, et habitantem de Ascalone, et convertam manum meam super Accaron: et peribunt reliqui Philisthinorum, dicit Dominus Deus.
verses.english: I will destroy the one who lives in Ashdod, and the one who lives in Ashkelon, and I will turn My hand against Ekron. The remnant of the Philistines will perish," says the Lord God.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus Tyri, et super quatuor, non convertam eum: eo quod concluserint captivos perfectos in Idumæa.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: "For three crimes of Tyre, and for four, I will not relent, because they handed over captives completely to Edom."

verses.latin: Et mittam ignem in murum Tyri, et comedet fundamenta ejus.
verses.english: I will send fire into the walls of Tyre, and it will consume its foundations.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus Idumææ, et super quatuor, non convertam eum: eo quod persecutus sit in gladio fratrem suum, et fregerit omne misericordiam, et in furore suo laceravit semper, et ira ejus custodivit in perpetuum.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: "For three crimes of Edom, and for four, I will not relent, because he pursued his brother with the sword, and broke every mercy, and in his fury he always tore him apart, and his anger kept itself forever."

verses.latin: Et mittam ignem in Theman, et comedet fundamenta Bosræ.
verses.english: I will send fire into Teman, and it will consume the foundations of Bozrah.

verses.latin: Haec dicit Dominus: Super tribus sceleribus filiorum Ammon, et super quatuor, non convertam eum: eo quod dissecuerint prægnantes Galad, ut dilatarent terminos suos.
verses.english: This is what the Lord says: "For three crimes of the Ammonites, and for four, I will not relent, because they ripped open the pregnant women of Gilead, in order to expand their territory."

verses.latin: Et succendam ignem in murum Rabba, et comedet fundamenta ejus in clamore in die belli, et in turbine in die contritionis.
verses.english: I will set fire to the walls of Rabbah, and it will consume its foundations, with a shout on the day of battle, and with a whirlwind on the day of destruction.

verses.latin: Et ibit rex eorum in captivitatem, ipse et principes ejus simul, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: Their king will go into captivity, along with his princes," says the Lord.

verses.latin: Haec ostendit mihi Dominus Deus: et ecce fiscella pomorum aestimatorum.
verses.english: This is what the Lord God showed to me, and behold, a basket of ripe fruits.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Quid vides, Amos? Et dixi: Fiscella pomorum aestimatorum. Et dixit Dominus ad me: Venit finis super populum meum Israel: ultra non adjiciam ut ei parcam.
verses.english: And He said, “What do you see, Amos?” And I said, “A basket of ripe fruits.” Then the Lord said to me, “The end has come for My people Israel. I will not spare them any further.

verses.latin: Et ululabunt cantica templi in die illa, dicit Dominus Deus: Multi mortui projicientur in loco tacito: auferentur.
verses.english: In that day, the songs of the Temple will turn to wailing, says the Lord God. Many corpses will be cast out, in the place where they are buried.

verses.latin: Audite hoc, qui conteritis pauperem, et subvertitis egenos terrae,
verses.english: Hear this, you who oppress the poor and destroy the needy of the land.

verses.latin: dicentes: Quando transibit mensis, et venundabimus frumentum? et sabbatum, et aperiemus horreum, ut imminuamus mensuram, et augeamus siclum, et subvertamus stateram dolosam,
verses.english: You say, “When will the new moon be over, so that we may sell our grain? When will the Sabbath be over, so that we may open our storehouses? We want to make the measure smaller, and increase the price, and falsify the scales.

verses.latin: ut emamus in argento pauperes, et egenos pro calceo, et stramenta frumenti vendamus.
verses.english: We want to buy the poor with silver and the needy for a pair of sandals. We want to sell even the discarded wheat.

verses.latin: Juravit Dominus in superbiam Jacob: Quia non obliviscar in sempiternum omnia opera eorum.
verses.english: The Lord has sworn by the pride of Jacob: I will never forget all their deeds.

verses.latin: Numquid super hoc non contremiscet terra, et lugebit omnis habitator ejus? et ascendet quasi fluvius, et ejicietur, et deprimetur quasi flumen AEgypti.
verses.english: Will not the land tremble for this, and will not all who dwell in it mourn? The land will rise like the Nile, and it will surge up and then sink like the river of Egypt.

verses.latin: Et erit in die illa, dicit Dominus Deus, contristabo solem in meridie, et obtenebrabo terram in die lucis.
verses.english: And in that day, says the Lord God, I will make the sun go down at noon, and I will darken the land in broad daylight.

verses.latin: Et convertam festivitates vestras in luctum, et omnia cantica vestra in planctum: et inducam super omne dorsum vestrum saccum, et super omnem caput calvitium: et faciam quasi luctum unigeniti, et novissima ejus quasi diem amarum.
verses.english: I will turn your feasts into mourning, and all your songs into lamentation. I will bring sackcloth upon every back, and baldness upon every head. I will make it like mourning for an only son, and its end as a bitter day.

verses.latin: Ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et mittam famem in terram: non famem panis, neque sitim aquae, sed audiendi verbi Domini.
verses.english: Behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will send a famine on the land—not a famine of bread or a thirst for water, but of hearing the words of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et movebuntur a mari usque ad mare, et a septentrione usque ad orientem: currunt quaerentes verbum Domini, et non invenient.
verses.english: They will wander from sea to sea, and from the north to the east; they will run to and fro, seeking the word of the Lord, but they will not find it.

verses.latin: In die illa deficiet virgo speciosa, et juvenes, in siti.
verses.english: In that day the beautiful virgins and the young men will faint from thirst.

verses.latin: Qui jurant in delusionem Samariae, et dicunt: Vivit Deus tuus, Dan, et vivit via Bersabee, et cadent, et non resurgent ultra.
verses.english: Those who swear by the sin of Samaria, who say, “As your god lives, O Dan,” and, “As the way of Beersheba lives,” they will fall, and never rise again.

verses.latin: Vidi Dominum stantem super altare, et dixit: Percute cardinem, et commoveantur superliminaria; et confregit in caput omnium, et novissimum eorum in gladio interficiam: non erit eis fugiens, et non salvabitur ex eis qui fugerit.
verses.english: I saw the Lord standing near the altar and He said, “Strike at the top of the temple! Shake the threshold of the doors. The temple will collapse above their heads, and I will kill the rest of them by the sword. No one will escape, and no one will survive who runs away.”

verses.latin: Si descenderint usque ad infernum, inde manum mea educam eos: et si ascenderint usque in caelum, inde detraham eos.
verses.english: “Even if they dig their way into hell, I will bring them out. If they climb all the way up to the sky, I will bring them down.

verses.latin: Et si absconditi fuerint in vertice Carmeli, inde quaeram et adducam eos: et si celaverint se a conspectu meo in profundo maris, ibi mandabo serpenti, et mordebit eos.
verses.english: “If they hide in the highest place on Mount Carmel, I will search for them and bring them out. If they hide from me on the ocean floor, I will command the sea serpent to bite them.

verses.latin: Et si abierint in captivitatem coram inimicis suis, ibi mandabo gladio, et interficiam eos: et ponam oculos meos super eos in malum, et non in bonum.
verses.english: “If they are led away into captivity by their enemies, I will command the sword and kill them. I will fix my eyes on them for bad, and not for good.”

verses.latin: Dominus Deus exercituum est qui tangit terram, et tabescit: et plangent omnes habitatores ejus: et ascendet quasi rivus omnis, et conprimetur quasi flumen Aegypti.
verses.english: The Lord God of hosts touches the earth and makes it melt, and all who live on the earth mourn. The earth will rise up like the Nile River, and then it will recede like the Nile.

verses.latin: Qui aedificat in caelo ascensionem suam, et fundamentum suum super terram fundat: qui vocat aquas maris, et effundit eas super faciem terrae: Dominus nomen ejus.
verses.english: God has built His high place in the sky, and He has set the foundation of the Temple on the earth. He calls up the waters of the sea and pours them over the face of the earth. The Lord is His name.

verses.latin: Numquid non sicut filii Aethiopum vos estis mihi, filii Israel? dicit Dominus. Numquid non adduxi Israel de terra Aegypti, et Palestinos de Caphtor, et Syros de Cyro?
verses.english: “Are you not like the children of Ethiopia to me, children of Israel?” says the Lord. “Did I not bring Israel out of the land of Egypt, and the Philistines from Caphtor, and the Arameans from Kir?

verses.latin: Ecce oculi Domini Dei super regnum peccatoris, et conteram illud a facie terrae: verumtamen non usque ad interitum, dicit Dominus.
verses.english: “I am the Lord. I see the sin in this kingdom, and I will destroy it from the face of the earth. But I will not destroy them completely,” says the Lord.

verses.latin: Quia ecce ego mandabo, et ventilabo in omnibus gentibus, sicut ventilatur triticum in area, et non cadet granum in terram.
verses.english: “I will give the command, and I will shake them among all the nations, like you shake wheat in the barn. Not a grain will fall to the ground.

verses.latin: Peccatores populi mei morientur in gladio, qui dicunt: Non appropinquabit, nec praeveniet nos malum.
verses.english: “The sinners of my people will die by the sword, those who say, ‘Evil will not come near us.’”

verses.latin: In die illa suscitabo tabernaculum David, quod corruit: et aedificabo rupturas ejus, et diruta ejus aedificabo: et aedificabo illud sicut diebus antiquis,
verses.english: “On that day, I will reestablish the fallen kingdom of David. I will repair its breaks, rebuild its ruins, and restore it as it was in the ancient days,

verses.latin: ut possideant reliquias Edom, et omnes gentes, quia invocatum est nomen meum super eos, dicit Dominus faciens haec.
verses.english: so they may take possession of what remains of Edom and of all the nations. These are the people who are called by my name,” says the Lord, who does these things.

verses.latin: Ecce dies veniunt, dicit Dominus, et comprehendet arator messorem, et calcator uvas, spargentem semen: et stillabunt montes dulcedinem, et omnes colles erunt cum fructibus.
verses.english: “The days are coming,” says the Lord, “when the one plowing will catch the reaper, and the one who treads grapes will catch the one who is scattering the seeds. The mountains will drip with sweetness, and all the hills will be filled with fruits.

verses.latin: Et convertam captivitatem populi mei Israel: et aedificabunt civitates desolatas, et habitabunt: et plantabunt vineas, et bibent vinum earum: et facient hortos, et comedent fructus eorum.
verses.english: “I will restore the captivity of my people Israel. They will rebuild the ruined cities and live there. They will plant vineyards and drink their wine. They will make gardens and eat their fruit.

verses.latin: Et plantabo eos super terram suam: et non eradicabo eos amplius de terra sua quam dedi eis, dicit Dominus Deus tuus.
verses.english: “I will plant them on their own land. They will never again be uprooted from the land that I have given them,” says the Lord your God.
